caption.p:
Comparison with influenza results. Removing precipitation from our regression model and including a quadratic humidity term reveals a very similar response ( a) to earlier work on influenza ( b adapted from Tamerius et al.
9 , Fig 3a) suggesting potential similar mechanisms underlie the climate effect on the two diseases. Predicted minimum transmission for RSV occurs at 11.16 g/kg, with influenza found to be similarly 11–12 g/kg
9 . Tamerius et al. suggest precipitation may drive the right hand side of the humidity-influenza curve, as we find for RSV.
